error.permissions: You don't have sufficient permissions to use this command.
error.mepermissions: I don't have sufficient permissions to use run this command.
error.noip: {emojierror} There is no IP set on this server, please set one using: `/setip`
error.errip: Han error has been ocurred, but don't worry i already notified to my developer to repair this problem, try again or use this IP server:

NSFW: <:access_denied:916930301018664983> **This command can only be used on a restricted channel (NSFW)**

setlang.nooption:
**You must put an option.** 
Format:  
```js
{prefix}setlang <Options: English or Spanish>```

prefix.noargs:
{emojidanger} **You must write a special argument to set it as a prefix.**
Example:
```js
{prefix}prefix <Arguments: p! | $ | % >```
prefix.yargs: {successemoji} **My prefix has been successfully set on this server to:** `{prefix}`
prefix.already:
{emojidanger} **The prefix you have tried to set for me is already set on this server!**
Format use:
```js
{prefix}prefix <Arguments: p! | $ | % >```

cserver.seted: {checkedmoji} The IP of your server 1 has been set to: **{iport}**
cserver.seted1: {checkedmoji} The IP of your server 2 has been set to: **{iport}**
cserver.seted2: {infomoji} You can see the server status using the commands: `/server`, `/ip`

rip.r1:
{success} **The IP server selected has been removed from this server.**
 **Note:** If u wanna add another IP use: `/setip`

step1.2:
Set you prefer language in the server using:
 `/setlanguage <Required Select: Es / En >`, (Es/En (More Coming Soon))

step2.2:
To set the IP of your SAMP server you can use:
 `/setip <Required Select: Server1 / Server2>` You can add a maximum of 2 IPs.

step3.2:
Now you can check the IP address of you server samp using: 
`/server` or `/ip`

other.1:
If you wanna remove a IP you can use the command:
 `/removeip <Required Select: Server1 / Server2>`

index.coldown: Wait **{time}** to use this command again.
index.channel: {error} This command can only be executed on the channel: {channel}

support.1: **To enter in the server support press the button:**

servers.3:
**Note:**
To see the information of a server use: `/ip [Server]`

schannel.1: {check} The selected channel has been correctly established as a command channel, now the users who are going to use my available commands will have to enter that channel for the commands to work. **(Includes: Admins)**
schannel.2:
{err} You should not select any voice channels or categories, only text channels. 
 {usage}

invite.1: Hi! Thank you for being interested in me, if you want to add me to your server, press the following button: **[Invite]({link})**

help.1: To get more info in commands use: `/help [Command Name]`

rchannel.1:
{check} The channel that was set to use commands there has been successfully removed. 
 Note: If you wanna change the channel or add another use: ``/setchannel <Required select: Channel / ID>`
rchannel.2: {error} There is no established channel, if you want to add one use: `/setchannel <Required select: Channel / ID>`
